fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Some of our customers may face an issue that will return 500 errors when navigating to URL routes that contain the pattern 
{code:java}
https://../project/<projectkey>
{code}
h3. Environment

NA
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login to Jira
 # Browse to project related URLs

h3. Expected Results

Should be able to proceed with browsing normally for pages like "Browse Projects"
h3. Actual Results

Instead customer hits a 500 error like shown below  !Capture.PNG|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

NA
h3. Workaround
 * Please use alternative URL with browse in it, eg https://<tenant>.atlassian.net/browse/<projectKey> instead of https://<tenant>.atlassian.net/projects/<projectKey>
 * Which is what the “Back to project” button points to in JSD/JSW next-gen project settings at the top of the navigation
fields.summary: Navigating to project related URLs throw 500 errors for some customers

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Some users have sandbox instances where they test changes and perform imports on repeatedly. Irregardless if you choose to overwrite or merge user data the groups will remain which can cause the group list to grow large in size with no easy way to bulk delete.

h3. Suggested Solution

Give an option to delete groups during site imports

h3. Workaround 

Use Jira Rest API to delete groups
fields.summary: Provide option to wipe groups during site import

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

With the introduction of the 'Merge user data' option with Jira site restores, there needs to be a way for admins to easily see what changes occurred from a site restore using the merge option.

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide summaries of what users will be added, and what groups/site-access have been added

h3. Workaround 

Export users and groups to CSV files for comparison after imports are completed
fields.summary: As an Admin I want a way to compare user changes after an import

fields.description: A number field in Jira is truncated on the 3rd decimal place. In some cases, the users need more decimal places to represent their numbers. It would be useful if there was an option to add more decimal places to a number field in case the users need.
fields.summary: Custom Field "Number Field" is truncated to the 3rd decimal place

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-67559].
  {panel}

h3. Definition
For a project admin, it is important to know who are the users working on a specific project. Currently, you need to be a JIRA admin to be able to view who the members of a group are. It totally makes sense for a project admin to be granted with this capability. 

h3. Suggestion
Allow the project administrators to view the members of a group assigned to a project role.
fields.summary: Allow Project Administrators to View the Members of the groups Assigned to a Project Role

fields.description:
While following the document below and creating Service Desk issues with attachment, we have an option to upload the file using our Native Computer:

 

[https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/rest/#api-rest-servicedeskapi-servicedesk-serviceDeskId-attachTemporaryFile-post]

 

However, there is no option to pass a URL of an image if the image is not hosted locally.

 

We need this option to be available as customers using REST commands usually don't have the image hosted locally on their systems.

Workaround:

 

The only workaround we have is to host the image locally and upload it from there.

fields.description:
Currently, hitting SPACE while in the kanban view should have two behaviors:
 * When no story is highlighted, page scroll forward (and shift-space makes it go back) is fine if it's even useful at all in this context. This is default Chrome browser behavior.
 * When a story card is highlighted, space should be overridden to open the story modal, and a following space or ESC should dismiss it.

{color:#de350b}*Bonus UX request*{color}: Let arrow keys fly around the cards.

_+*{{{color:#57d9a3}Special tip{color}}}*+_ for my lack of textual description: This is how Finder works on a mac. Do that, and you'll have introduced some rockin', usable UI/UX.

Good morning :D
fields.summary: In Jira Kanban, hitting kb SPACE should open/hide single story modal view when a story card is in focus

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
JSON-importer currently ignores the "active"-field, when creating a new user: all such users are created as active, even if the field's value is _false_:

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a JSON file with a user to be imported
 # Set this user to be imported as inactive and import the file
{code}
{
"users": [ 
  {
        "name" : "abcde-12345-fedcba",
        "groups" : [ "site-admins" ],
        "active" : false,
        "email" : "gsenna@testbug.com",
        "fullname" : "User 1"
  }
]
}
{code}

h3. Expected Results
The user is imported as inactive, not being added to any Product of the instance.

h3. Actual Results
The user is added to the instance as Active, counting towards the licensing.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Import Users via JSON is Always Setting Them as Active Even if Set as Inactive in the File

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In a Jira issue using the new issue view, when a user right-clicks on a Confluence page or Github link, it doesn't show open link options whereas it does for linked Jira issues. Instead, it shows as if the user had right-clicked anywhere on the page where there wasn't a link.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new Jira Software project
 # Create a new space in the Confluence linked to the Jira and add a page to the space
 # Add issues to the Jira projet
 # Edit the Confluence page and add the link of some Jira issues. Save the page
 # Go back to Jira and access one of the mentioned issues
 # Right-click the Confluence page link under *Confluence pages*

h3. Expected Results
It does show open link options

h3. Actual Results
It doesn't show open link options
!Screen Recording 2019-07-26 at 09.22 PM.gif|width=523,height=266!

h3. Notes
This erroneous behavior is experienced by right-clicking on it, Ctrl + left-clicking on it (Windows) and clicking on it with the middle mouse button. However, on Mac, the Command + Left click seems to work.

h3. Workaround
Disable the new issue view. To do it, please follow the steps described below:
 # Go to Jira home page and click on the avatar at the bottom-left of the screen and then click on *Personal settings*
 # Under *Jira labs*, next to *New Jira issue view for software projects*, disable this feature by clicking on the green button (it will become gray and a feedback pop-up will appear)
 # Access the affected projects
fields.summary: Right-clicking on Confluence/GitHub links in the new issue view doesn't show some options

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Changing the configuration of ISO8601 in the Look and Feel Settings https://<your-instance>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/LookAndFeel!default.jspa in order to cause Monday to be the first day of week in the Date Picker field doesn't work on the New Issue View.

h3. Environment

 * Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Goto the Look and Feel Settings or https://<your-instance>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/LookAndFeel!default.jspa
 # Change the *Use ISO8601 standard in Date Picker* to "Yes" and update
# Visit an Issue that has a Date picker field and try to view the Calendar pop up dialog screen.

h3. Expected Results
The Calendar should show the Start of the week begins on a "monday"

h3. Actual Results
The Calendar doesn't respect the configuration and still shows the previous settings of Sunday being the first day of the week.
 !new-issue-view.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
*Problem Statement:* On a Kanban board, if you move a story to "Selected for Development" status, its children sub-tasks stay in the backlog status, which doesn't make sense.  Here my reasoning: Sub-tasks are meant to be kept with the story.  So if you plan to complete a story, you should also plan to complete (or reject or move) all the sub-tasks that go with it.  It is bad housekeeping to close a story and not its sub-tasks.  Having said that, this functionality both promotes bad habits and is annoying/error-prone since you have to remember to manually move all the sub-tasks to the "Selected for Development" status in order for them to show up on the kanban board.  

*Solution:* When a story is moved to "Selected for Development," have sub-tasks auto transition to that state also.   However, don't have sub-tasks auto transition for other story workflow status as the rest of the statuses should be set manually by the user.  In fact, it would be good to disallow closing the parent story if its sub-tasks are not in a done state.  

*Considerations:*  To solve this, you could just make the backlog view work like a scrum board, where the sub-tasks don't show up and instead they move with the story.  However, I've heard some folks would like Sub-tasks to show up in the backlog, so maybe you can add a toggle to enable/disable sub-tasks in the backlog.
fields.summary: Sub-tasks Move with Story to "Selected for Development" Status.

fields.description:
{panel:title=Update 16th July, 2021|titleBGColor=#e0efff}
Hi all,

I'm pleased to be able to announce that we've now rolled out support for OAuth 2.0 with Gmail accounts. Configuring a new Google custom inbox will now take you through Google's OAuth 2.0 permission screen instead of asking for a username and password. See [the documentation|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/email-process-for-pop-imap-cloud-and-other-email-types/] for details on how we interact with your email inbox.

Thanks for your patience,

Avi

Developer, Jira Service Management
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

When connecting from JIRA to Gmail for Mail Handler, user will hit error
{code:java}
Please log in via your web browser
{code}
h3. Suggested Solution

Make JIRA more secure to be able to connect to Gmail without additional configuration
h3. Why this is important

Make sure connectivity between JIRA and Gmail more secure
h3. Workaround
 * Enabling access for less secure app in gmail seems to work for most of the cases
 * If it doesn't work, as per the error message, please refer to the following link for more information about the error.
 [https://support.google.com/mail/answer/78754]
fields.summary: Improve Jira Service Desk Desk Security Standard to integrate with OAuth when configuring Mail Handler

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Text in issues in old issue view with a smaller than sign (<) inside square brackets (\[ and \]) cannot be correctly converted to new issue view. A text like this breaks:
{code}
[<]
{code}

It also breaks if text is added outside or inside the brackets:
{code}
Text [Text<Text]Text
{code}

If this text is added to ticket in old issue view:
!old_issue_view.png|thumbnail!

Then the issue is opened in new issue view, it shows an error if we try to edit the field:
!new_issue_view_editing.png|thumbnail!
{code}
We can't display part of this content correctly
It contains formatting we don’t recognize. Before you save, test any links and check other content for formatting problems
{code}

If the user doesn't have edit permissions in the ticket (due to Permission Scheme configuration, workflow property, etc.) the field is not rendered and shows as empty:
!new_issue_view_no_edit_permission.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a ticket
 # Edit its description in old issue view and add this: {{\[<\]}}
 # View it in new issue view and try to edit it.

h3. Expected Results
It works as expected.

h3. Actual Results
Editing the field fails with an error (shown above) if the user has Edit Issues permission. If not, the field is shown empty.

h3. Notes
Strangely enough, this is not reproducible with greater than signs.

This may be a problem in cases where Jira appends this to issues created via email:
{code}
[Created via e-mail received from: Jane Doe <jdoe@domain.com>]
{code}

h3. Workaround
# Edit the issue in the old issue view
# Escape either (or both) square brackets with a backslash 
#* Escaping the smaller than sign won't work
fields.summary: Smaller than sign inside square brackets breaks conversion to new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using a User Picker (multiple users) based custom field in new issue view, all values are duplicated except the last alphabetic value. The duplicate doesn't show initially, but as the page continues to load, the duplicate values then show up. Doesn't appear to affect single user picker or other random custom field types.
h3. Environment
 * Jira Cloud (new issue view only)

Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a User Picker (multiple users) custom field
 # Add values to that field in an issue
 # Ensure you are viewing in the new issue view (old issue view doesn't appear to be affected)
 # Reload the page and see that the duplicate values are present

h3. Expected Results

Each value shows once.
h3. Actual Results

All values are duplicated except the last one (alphabetically speaking).
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Adding values to a User Picker (multiple users) field duplicates most values in that field for new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Description
When adding users to a class project in Jira, if the user already belongs to the project, a message should appear next to their name.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Add a user with a role to a project;
# Type the name of the same user, and add them to the list of users;

h3. Expected behavior
Before clicking the button *Add*, a message should inform that the user already belongs to the project.

h3. Actual results
There's an error on the UI informing that the user could not be added to the project.

h3. Why this is important
When trying to add multiple people to a project, if you happen to add one user who is already an admin, none of the users will be added, and the attempt will fail. This can be frustrating when adding multiple users to a project.

h3. Workaround
Instead of adding individual users, grant roles to groups.
fields.summary: When trying to add an user to a project, if the user already belongs to it, a short text message should appear next to their name

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31806].
{panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – July 30, 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thank you for your continued support and patience as we are making progress on the cloud-to-cloud migration release as part of the early access program.

Today I am happy to share that we have invited the final batch of customers for the early access program. During this phase we selected customers who are looking to move between instances over the month of August.

If you want to participate in the program, please reach out to the support team.

During Phase 2 of the program, we were able to identify 14 more bugs. We truly appreciate all the EAP participants who tried the product and gave their valuable feedback.

As a final piece, we will be sharing a short survey to get further feedback about your experience with the tool and how we can improve it further.

Best wishes,
Ritesh Ranjan
Product Manager, Migrations

 
{panel}
{panel:title=March 11, 2021  }
Hi everyone,

I want to share some exciting news about the early access program for Jira cloud-to-cloud migration feature that we have been working on.

We’ve been working to build a simple path for migrating projects between cloud sites within the same organization, and today I am happy to announce an early access program for Jira Cloud-to-Cloud Migration, a new feature within Jira. The goal of the program is to test real-world data migration and to get feedback from your experience, thereby helping us build a robust product before we offer the capability more broadly.

You can read more about the program at [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Atlassian-Cloud-Migration/Jira-Cloud-to-Cloud-Migration-is-here-Get-early-access/ba-p/1635678]

You can signup at [https://surveys.atlassian.com/jfe/form/SV_6SAs9OX0eAbGk5f]

Check detailed documentation at [ttps://migration-docs.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/CTCM/overview?homepageId=32973|https://migration-docs.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/CTCM/overview?homepageId=32973]

Thank you for your patience in this journey. Your interest and comments on this ticket has helped shape this. I look forward to speaking with you as we get closer to making this feature live with the early access program .

Cheers,
 Ritesh Ranjan
 Product Manager, Atlassian Cloud Migrations

 
{panel}
*Original Request*

Currently the Data Importer only supports "Instance" ([http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Restoring+Data]) imports, but support for for "Single Project" ([http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Restoring+a+Project+from+Backup]) imports is also required.

This limitation makes instance migration/merge a difficult task.

*Workaround:*
 [How to merge two JIRA Cloud instances|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CLOUDKB/How+to+merge+two+JIRA+Cloud+instances]
fields.summary: Provide support for "Single Project" imports between Jira Cloud sites

h3. Issue Summary

When a project is deleted, its screens that were created automatically during project creation, don't get deleted. This could lead to Cloud instance having a lot of unused screens.

 # Delete the project

The screens are deleted. 
h3. Actual Results

Those screens are not deleted. If users keep doing this action (Create & delete project), there will be quite number unused screens which leads to failing in project creation. There is a generic error showing "Project not created" when that happens.
 * !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

Delete some screens.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary When exporting to server, the downloaded file contains a foreignKey reference to the table project, column id. However, the table and column name are in uppercase: {code:java} {code} This leads to errors when importing on server. (e.g. https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-69564) However, the entire table is not needed on server; it is only used on cloud.   h3. Steps to Reproduce # Export a backup via Setttings -> System -> Backup manager -> Create backup for server # Download and unzip the export file # Inside the unzipped folder, examine activeobjects.xml # It contains a reference to the table AO_2C4E5C_MAILWHITELISTS including the foreignKey causing issues during import. h3. Expected Results The table AO_2C4E5C_MAILWHITELISTS should not be exported to server. h3. Actual Results The below tags are exported as part of the activeobjects.xml file: {noformat}
{noformat} h3. Workaround The problematic line has to be removed from *activeobjects.xml* file: {code:xml} {code} The following steps can be used to perform and validate this change: # Unzip cloud backup {code:java} unzip cloudbackup.zip Archive: cloudbackup.zip inflating: entities.xml inflating: activeobjects.xml{code} # Expand xml to multiple lines: {code:java} xmllint activeobjects.xml --format > activeobjects_fixed.xml && mv activeobjects_fixed.xml activeobjects.xml {code} # Remove the foreign key entry. # Zip backup back together. {code:java} zip -r cloudbackup_fixed.zip activeobjects.xml entities.xml{code} # Move the backup to the import directory on the destination instance and perform the import
fields.summary: Export to server produces file that fails to import.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Duplicate notifications are sent when the current user and recipient are the same user

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a notification scheme with the following set up:
* All Watchers
* Current Assignee
* Current User
* Reporter
# Triggers the action configured above.

h3. Expected Results
* Use should receive a single notification

h3. Actual Results
* The user receives a duplicated notification.
 
h3. Notes
This happens if the user is either the Assignee and the user who triggered the action(current user).

h3. Workaround
Remove the _current user_ notification and configure under the profile settings to receive notifications of their own changes.
fields.summary: Duplicate notifications are sent when the current user and recipient are the same user

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 14 October 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone, thank you for your interest surrounding this ticket. Before we begin [transitioning all users to the new issue view|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-articles/Transitioning-all-Jira-Cloud-users-to-the-new-issue-view/ba-p/1494104] on 31 March, 2021, we’ll be solving this problem. Watch this ticket for updates as we progress and please add a comment for any questions you may have.
{panel}

h3. Problem definition
In the new issue view, it's only possible to have multi-line text fields in the description area.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability to have more types of custom fields in the description area, not only multi-line text fields.

h3. Why this is important
This should allow more customization to different types of projects. And also allow users to be able to see important information that's not tied to multi-line text fields in the description area.

h3. Workaround
There is none.
fields.summary: As an admin, I'd like to have more types of custom fields allowed to be in the description area

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using the Datepicker field type on the new issue view for sub-task issuetype doesn't work. in order to determine this, make the field required on the sub-task issuetype and notice that the calendar doesn't pop out.

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field using the datepicker field type
 # Add this custom field to the Screen of a Project.
# Make this field required in the field configuration.
# Create a Parent Issue, then subsequently try to create a subtask inline in order to bring out the Create Screen to fill in a value for that custom field.


h3. Expected Results
The calendar dialog should pop out for the user to select the required date and time for the custom field.

h3. Actual Results
Notice, that the Calendar doesn't pop out and doesn't work. The calendar icon seems disabled
 !error.png|thumbnail! 

The below exception is thrown in the console log on *Chrome*:
{code}
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'DEF_DATE_FORMAT' of undefined
    at new Calendar (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&devsummary=true&globalSidebarEnabled=true&jag=true&locale=en-US:4942)
    at n (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&devsummary=true&globalSidebarEnabled=true&jag=true&locale=en-US:4945)
    at HTMLAnchorElement.<anonymous> (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&devsummary=true&globalSidebarEnabled=true&jag=true&locale=en-US:4945)
    at HTMLAnchorElement.dispatch (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&devsummary=true&globalSidebarEnabled=true&jag=true&locale=en-US:82)
    at HTMLAnchorElement.h (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&devsummary=true&globalSidebarEnabled=true&jag=true&locale=en-US:74)
{code}

h3. Notes
On Firefox shows references to *TypeError: Calendar._TT is undefined*  [Learn more|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Errors/Unexpected_type]

h3. Workaround
 * Change to the Old Issue view https://<your-instance>.atlassian.net/browse/ABC-123?oldIssueView=true and perform the same action and it works
* Manually enter the date and time value on the field as it allows editing.
fields.summary: Custom field of Datepicker field type doesn't work on new issue view for Sub-task Issuetype

From: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/FEEDBACK-368715
h3. Issue Summary

I repeatedly hit a formatting bug when saving my comment or putting together an issue after adding a handful of images inline.

> "We could not save your comment. It might be empty or have invalid formatting. If you copy-pasted, try removing the formatting and adding it directly in the editor."
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Insert an image via the editor, drag and drop, or from your clipboard. 
 # Cut or copy the image using (Ctrl + X / Ctrl + C) to different section of the comment. (For best reproduction, try pasting between two paragraphs of text). 
 # Attempt to save the comment. 

h3. Expected Results

Comment saves with images attached
h3. Actual Results

Comment fails to save, with the following error message:

> "We could not save your comment. It might be empty or have invalid formatting. If you copy-pasted, try removing the formatting and adding it directly in the editor."
h3. Workaround

One solution is to delete the whole comment and re-add the images... one-by-one, or paste the text into another text editor and add it back in without formatting, but this a time consuming workaround.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Please Note the current Documentation Inconsistency BUG about the expected default behavior when a Boolean is used:
- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-72541

Clarification Reference from Basic Search documentation found here: ["Search syntax for text fields"|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/search-syntax-for-text-fields-764478343.html], Noting that the expected default behavior of not using a boolean value between two terms is the "AND" operator not the "OR" operator as both variations are currently listed in the document and the following statement is true:
{quote}
"If you combine multiple terms without specifying any Boolean operators, they will be joined using AND operators."
{quote}

However when doing a Query that has two terms missing an Operator nested inside a Group the behavior defaults to a "+" rather than an "AND"
EXE using a very simple text search:
in the Text field search for *test (singleTerm OR term OR compound word)*  noting that compound word is actually two separate terms where Term 1 = "compound" and term 2 = "word" per definition criteria of a Term:
{quote}
There are two types of terms: single terms (e.g. "hello") and phrases (e.g. "hello dolly")
{quote}

This would be consider a Phrase if placed in quotes, as there are no quotes the default  conjunction operator should be "AND" however we are seeing behavior similar to the "+" Operator unless explicitly flagged as "AND" or as "OR" in the query.

h3. Environment
Cloud & Server affected Tested and verified behavior on current Cloud version and server version in the range 7.2, 7.13, 8.0, & 8.2

If using Jira Server See corresponding Server Bug Report here: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-69650

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create Requests containing only one of the following in each issues Description and any other combination that you want to verify against:
{quote}
test word
test compound test word
{quote}
# Run the search using Control search
{code}
test (singleTerm OR term OR compound word)
{code}
#run the search using verification search
{code}
test (singleTerm OR term OR compound AND word)
test (singleTerm OR term OR compound + word)
{code}


h3. Expected Results
Expected that control query *test (singleTerm OR term OR compound word)*  and the "AND" test query *test (singleTerm OR term OR compound AND word)* would return the same result set which would be the issue containing "test compound test word"

h3. Actual Results
both text combinations are returned and this is the same result set as the "+" operator test query

h3. Notes
It appears to be a conflict of the double AND application on the distributive action to the nested query inside the (grouping), as the portion "test()" is technically triggering the default conjunction operator as a "test AND ()" with the additional distribution of the alternate default conjunction operator portion "AND word" making it "test AND AND word" causing some conflict in logic at this point,  

As an additional visual exe manual distribution of operators in the string *test (singleTerm OR term OR compound word)* to a advanced query should look like this:
{code}
text ~ (test AND single term) OR (test AND term) OR (test AND compound) AND (test AND word)
{code}
BUT is actually being treated as:
{code}
text ~ (test AND single term) OR (test AND term) OR ((test AND compound) AND (test AND word))
{code}
OR
{code}
text ~ (test AND single term) OR (test AND term) OR (test AND compound) + (test AND word)
{code}


h3. Workaround
First NOTE the "AND" is expected not the "OR" per the linked documentation BUG, so use the "AND" operator variable Manually rather than relying on the query to use a whitespace to default to the default conjunction operator "AND"  especially when used in nested queries to verify the correct search operator is being used.
OR 
Rely on Advanced Search queries as defined in:
- [Advanced Searching|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/advanced-searching-764478330.html]
fields.summary: Basic Search default Boolean inside a Group is incorrectly mapped to "+" operator

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In the Documentation for Basic Search:
* [Search syntax for text fields|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/search-syntax-for-text-fields-764478343.html]

Quote1: In the section "Query Terms" it notes:
{quote}
"If you combine multiple terms without specifying any Boolean operators, they will be joined using AND operators."
{quote}

Quote 2: In the "OR" operator section it notes a conflicting point:
{quote}
"The OR operator is the default conjunction operator. This means that if there is no Boolean operator between two terms, the OR operator is used."
{quote}

Quote 1 States between 2 Terms a "AND" operator is used and Quote States between 2 terms a "OR" operator is used

Using the defined search criteria in the example of the documentation in the OR operator section, the second Quote is proven incorrect and the "AND" Operator is confirmed to be used instead of the "OR" operator as the Default conjunction operator.

h3. Environment
Cloud & Server Docs affected Tested and verified behavior on Current Cloud version and Server version 7.2, 7.13, 8.0, & 8.2
- If using Jira Server please see corresponding Server Documentation inconsistency Report here: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-69649

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 3 issues 
#* Place "atlassian jira" in a text field on one issue (exe description)
#* Place "Confluence" on the second
#* Place "atlassian jira" and "confluence" on the third
# using the Example in the OR section search for:
{code}
"atlassian jira" OR confluence
{code}
# all three issues are returned
# Remove the "OR" operator to align with the statement "This means that if there is no Boolean operator between two terms, the OR operator is used."

h3. Expected Results
All three issues are returned

h3. Actual Results
Only the issue with both "atlassian jira" and "confluence" is returned as the AND operator is being used

h3. Suggested Correction Needed

Remove the notation under the "OR" operator section noting:
{quote}
The OR operator is the default conjunction operator. This means that if there is no Boolean operator between two terms, the OR operator is used.
{quote}

Then under the "AND" operator section add in:
{quote}
The AND operator is the default conjunction operator. This means that if there is no Boolean operator between two terms, the AND operator is used.
{quote}
fields.summary: Incorrect information in Basic Search Documentation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The REST API endpoint [/rest/api/3/project/<projectIdOrKey>/role/<roleId>|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/?utm_source=%2Fcloud%2Fjira%2Fplatform%2Frest%2F&utm_medium=302#api-rest-api-3-project-projectIdOrKey-role-id-post] performance degrades significantly when trying to add users to a role which already is associated to large number (2000+) users within a project. 

This seems to be down to the specification of the endpoint:
bq. Returned if the request is successful. The complete list of actors for the project is returned.

Due to the performance of the query that retrieves this list it can take up to a minute for a single response to adding a user.

This can be especially problematic for Jira Service Desk projects which are not publicly open and have a large number of customers as these also are added to the role actors with the *Service Desk Customer* role

h3. Environment
Cloud with more that 2000 users in a project or a closed Jira Service Desk project with a combined more than 1000 users and customers.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create Jira project.
 # Add over 2000 users to the people page.
 # Use the rest endpoint to add further users. 

h3. Expected Results
The single POST request should be performant and return a response within a few seconds.

h3. Actual Results
The response returned can take close to a minute due to returning all role actors for the project.

h3. Notes
Perhaps a parameter to not return these results are an alternate endpoint where only a success or fail response is delivered could be a solution?

(Optional - If Necessary)
h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Add actors to project role API performance degrades significantly when a large number of users have a role in a project.

fields.description:
In the new issue view it is currently not possible to download all attachments at once, which is possible in the old issue view.

We regularly get > 5 attachments, which cannot be viewed in the attachment preview, and thus have to be downloaded. 
Having a "download all attachments" option would be a nice addition to save a bit of time.
fields.summary: New Issue View - Download all attachments

fields.description: Test bug, checking public attachments
fields.summary: Test bug, checking public attachments

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At this moment, when users and admins access any project then click "Issues and filters", Jira will show only system filters (no custom or starred filters)

 !No starred filters here.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability for users or admins to place custom or starred filters there

h3. Why this is important
This should improve the user experience.

h3. Workaround 
There are two. You can either:
1. Click the *Star* icon on your left sidebar, then the relevant starred item (in a 2-click process);
 !First click.png|thumbnail!  !Second click.png|thumbnail! 

2. Or create a *Shortcut* directing users to the filter's URL (although Jira will open this link in a new tab).
 !Shortcut.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to view my starred filters on the left sidebar even if I'm in a project context

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When accessing the upload file browser from the "Create issue" dialog, the user is not able to select "Insert 1 file" or "Insert x files" button if their window is below a certain height. This especially affects lower resolution monitors.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open the "Create issue" dialog
 # Click on the "Drop files to attach, or browse" link
 # Upload a file
 # Change the height of the browser window (make it shorter)
 # Observe the "Insert 1 file" or "Insert x files" button is missing/disappears

h3. Expected Results

The dialog should still show the "Insert ..." buttons.
h3. Actual Results

The button is missing (or disappears when making the window shorter).
h3. Workaround

Drag and drop files to the "Drop files to attach, or browse" section of the "Create issue" dialog.
fields.summary: Can't see "Insert x file(s)" on attachment prompt when browser window is below a certain height

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When accessing an issue collector's form, if the option to "Attempt to match user session of submitter or submitter email address" is enabled and the user who is trying to create the issue through the issue collector has a matched user session, the "not you" link in the phrase "This feedback will be created using this user unless this is not you." doesn't work at all.

h3. Steps to Reproduce (easier shown than described)

 [^JRACLOUD-72526.mp4] 

h3. Expected Results
By clicking "not you", the form should provide a way for the user to add the information of other person.

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens when users click "not you", meaning that the user whose session was matched will be the reporter of the issue.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Link "not you" isn't working in issue collector forms

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Due to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-71223 bug , issue being overwritten without knowing it.

h3. Suggested Solution
It is best if CSV import will alert upfront if the CSV file will update any issue before updating it.

h3. Why this is important
To make sure there's no unwanted issue being updated.

h3. Workaround 
No workaround
fields.summary: CSV import alert upfront if issue will be updated before process the import

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As currently, we have https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-71223 bug , due to JIRA ignored project key in the "issue key" field at CSV file and update the existing issue in the defined project with the match "issue number". This causing issue overwritten. 

h3. Suggested Solution
It is best to update the documentation, alert customer not to mapped "Issue Key" field if expected to create a new issue when already defined the project. 

h3. Why this is important
This to prevent from customer instance issue being overwritten.

h3. Workaround 
No workaround
fields.summary: Update "Importing data from CSV" documentation

fields.description:
h3. Description
When trying to edit fields on a screen, if the user is not a Jira administer, they will receive an error message indicating that their operation is taking longer than usual.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Go to Project settings > Fields;
# Choose one field and click on the screen associated with it;
# Choose one;

h3. Expected results
The user is informed that they don't have the correct permission to perform that operation

h3. Actual results
The user receives the following message:
"Your operation is taking longer than usual
Sorry, your operation is taking longer than usual.
Please try again in a few minutes.

If you're still seeing this screen after ten minutes
please raise a support request. "
 !Screen Shot 2019-07-18 at 09.29.00.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Error message for editing a screen field improvement

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a bulk deletion involves issues of custom subtask issue types, the deletion stops midway with error. The sub-tasks get partially deleted. If the sub-tasks are exclusively deleted first followed by the parents, the bulk deletion proceeds without any issues.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 4 custom sub-tasks.
 !Screenshot 2019-07-18 at 3.06.56 PM.png|thumbnail! 
# In a software project include these 4 custom subtasks.
 !Screenshot 2019-07-18 at 3.08.02 PM.png|thumbnail! 
# Create an issue in this project and create 4 sub-tasks each of the 4 different custom subtask type.
# Initiate a bulk deletion of all the subtasks along with the parent. The deletion halts with error.
 !Screenshot 2019-07-18 at 1.57.41 PM.png|thumbnail! 
# The issues in the bulk get partially deleted.

Replication video:  [^JST-484393-2.mov] 

h3. Expected Results

Both parent and subtasks get deleted successfully.

h3. Actual Results

An error with no description is thrown and the subtasks are partially deleted.

h3. Notes

* Issue is not reproducible if default sub-task is involved instead of custom sub-tasks.
* Issue is ONLY reproducible when a new issue is created and subtasks are added (not when we have already tried deleting the subtasks once and added more later).
* No errors can be seen in Splunk.

h3. Workaround

Delete the subtasks first followed by the parent.
fields.summary: Bulk deletion of issues with custom sub-tasks halts with error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using the External System Import, selecting the Trello option, to import data from Trello, multiple errors occur related to user import.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Board in Trello;
 # Create some lists with some cards on it;
 # Add users to these cards, come users can belong to a Jira instance, and some don't;
 # Go to External System Import in Jira, select the Trello option;
 # Follow the instructions to import the desired Board;

h3. Expected Results
The import result with no errors.

h3. Actual Results
Depending on the case, some errors are thrown. A couple of examples:
* If the user already exists in the Jira instance:
Cannot create user X: User X with status InactiveDueToLicenseRolesEnabled was not found after creating them.
* If the user doesn't belong to the instance:
Cannot create user Y: java.util.ConcurrentModificationException: com.atlassian.jira.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.UserNotFoundException: User Y does not exist
* Some users might lose their current permissions on the Jira instance, overwritten by the Trello import.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When importing data from Trello, multiple errors are shown related to users

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Adding a big comment into Jira breaks notification tab and can also crash the browser

h3. Environment
* Tested within Chrome and Firefox.
* In our tests we used 35000 characters


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add yourself as a watcher in a ticket
# Have another user to add a comment with around *35 thousand characters* to that ticket

h3. Expected Results
* In the case it is decided to allow comments this big, *it shouldn't break notifications or other things*.
* If technically unfeasible, Jira should not allow 

h3. Actual Results
If the comment generates an *in-app notification*, every time you try to open the *notifications tab*, you'll see the comment won't show the snippet, and likely your browser tab will stop working. See below:

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 

h3.Workaround

* If this broke your *notifications tab*, you'll need to delete the comment that originated.
fields.summary: Big comment breaks in-app notifications tab and crashes the browser tab

fields.description:

Using CSV import of issues with usernames or e-mails on those issues, the import completes but fails to import users if they were specified by email.

 # Fill the reporter field with a user e-mail;

h3. Expected Results

The import succeeds.
h3. Actual Results

The import succeeds with errors such as:
 * Cannot remove 'USE' permissions for user X
 * Cannot create user x@y.com: User X with status InactiveDueToLicenseRolesEnabled was not found after creating them.

h3. Workaround

See below
fields.summary: CSV Import returns InactiveDueToLicenseRolesEnabled

The JIRA server was contacted but has returned an error response. We are unsure of the result of this operation

# Create a project having project key either TRUE or FALSE
#  Open the create issue window (you can press 'c' or click on the create issue button)

fields.description:

Typing comments is slow on the New Issue View.
*Issue happens only when using Google Chrome 75.x*

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open an issue in the New Issue View using Chrome version 75.x.
# Start typing a comment
# As fast as you start typing the comment, it will be delaying/lagging

h3. Expected Results
Typing a comment should not have any lags/delays.

h3. Actual Results
There is a lag/delay when typing a comment.

h3. Workaround
In the Old Issue View adding comments works fine.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

As a user, I would like the + Create Issue in Epic button to open a pop-up that allows me to change the project of the issue I am creating in the Epic as it happened in the old issue view.
h3. Actual Scenario

The in-line creation only allows you to create issues in the Epic that belong to the same project.
h3. Expected Scenario

Open a pop-up window to allow me to select issues from other projects.
h3. Workaround

Set a field as required in the projects to enforce the pop-up screen to fill the required fields. 

Edit: Workaround does not work anymore because of the bug JRACLOUD-75648.
fields.summary: Create issue in Epic should open in a pop-up

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Some tickets containing code blocks in descriptors, etc. may crash the browser when viewed in the new issue view. 

This happens due to a regex running in the browser in a Java Script. Typical symptoms are: blank page showing the issue, high CPU usage for the browser tab (can be checked using browser tools) and tab and browser do not respond when attempting to close them (may require to force close the browser).

This happens to specific issues, so if an issue is impacted by this problem, other tickets should work correctly.

This is restricted to the new issue view.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a ticket with the broken block
# Open it in your browser using new issue view

h3. Expected Results
It opens correctly.

h3. Actual Results
It crashes the browser.

h3. Workaround

View and use the ticket in old issue view. 

You can either disable it completely for your user:
# Click your avatar picture in the left-side bar
# Click 'Personal Setting'
# Unselect 'New Jira issue view' setting

This will apply to all issues in system, apart from business and next-gen projects.

If you know the issue key, you can also directly access it in old issue view, but using this URL:
{code}
https://<instance>.atlassian.net/browser/<key>?oldIssueView=true
{code}
fields.summary: Code blocks in issues crash browser in new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to <instanceURL>/issues
# Select a filter (e.g. "the default "MY Open Issues" filter)
# Perform a change that would be visible on the filter results (e.g. assign to yourself a new issue)
# Click the filter name on the sidebar

h3. Expected Results
The filter should refresh and the changes be visible

h3. Actual Results
The filter will not refresh and new results will not be displayed.

h3. Workaround
Perform a full page refresh.
fields.summary: Clicking an active filter does not refresh its content

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the new Jira issue view, the multi line custom fields are shown incorrectly when a context scheme is applied


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 
|Create a multi line custom field and assign it to the screen of ProjectA.|.|
|Verify in the new issue view (full page) that the custom field is available. | !verify.png|thumbnail! |
|Edit the configuration of the custom field and restrict it to not be available for ProjectA.| !context.png|thumbnail! |

Check the full page of the issue again in the new Jira issue view.

h3. Expected Results

The custom field should be hidden as it is in the old view. 

h3. Actual Results

The custom field initially loads and then the filed name disappears leaving the placeholder with *None*

 !replicate.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround

Go to _*Project Settings > Issue Layout*_ and remove the unnecessary multiline custom fields from the configuration.
fields.summary: Incorrect rendering of contexed multi line custom fields.
